poem:
**Invisible Chains**

Under Mediterranean skies,
love bends the rules,
stealthily seeking sanction—
women weaving wishes in whispered
clinics, where futures hinge
on unseen nods, grey areas.
Caught in the cracks,
they breathe oppression like air,
unnoticing, unyielding,
their desires dispersed
in an Italy too blind 
to see real love bloom.
